episode_summary: This episode covers a variety of quirky historical and cultural facts, including Charles Dickens' pre-performance rituals, the ancient origins of Christmas jumpers, the blushing behavior of male turkeys, and the surprising dual career of the composer of 'Jingle Bells'.

facts.fact: Before going on stage to read a Christmas carol, Charles Dickens had a warm up routine of drinking a pint of champagne.
Crap Christmas jumpers date back to the Romans.
Male turkeys blush when they see female turkeys.
The composer of the song 'Jingle Bells' also wrote the 'Yuletide' classic 'We Conquer or Die'.
